Package com.flag4j.linalg.decompositions

Class SchurDecomposition<T extends MatrixMixin<T,​?,​?,​?,​?,​?>>

java.lang.Object
com.flag4j.linalg.decompositions.SchurDecomposition<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of matrix to compute the Schur decomposition of.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Decomposition<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComplexSchurDecomposition, RealSchurDecomposition
public abstract class SchurDecomposition<T extends MatrixMixin<T,​?,​?,​?,​?,​?>> extends Object implements Decomposition<T>

This abstract class specifies methods for computing the Schur decomposition of a square matrix. That is, decompose a square matrix A into A=UTU<sup>H</sup> where U is a unitary matrix whose columns are the eigenvectors of A and T is an upper triangular matrix in Schur form whose diagonal entries are the eigenvalues of A, corresponding to the columns of U, repeated per their multiplicity.

Note, even if a matrix has only real entries, both U and T may contain complex values.

  • Field Details

    • maxIterations

      protected int maxIterations
      The maximum number of iterations to run the QR algorithm when computing the Schur decomposition. This overrides the minimum number of iterations.

    • MIN_DEFAULT_ITERATIONS

      protected static final int MIN_DEFAULT_ITERATIONS
      The minimum number of iterations to perform by default in the QR algorithm if it has not converged. Specifically, the QR algorithm will run for max(MIN_ITERATIONS, maxIterations) iteration or until the QR algorithm converges, whichever comes first.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • useDefaultMaxIterations

      protected final boolean useDefaultMaxIterations
      Flag for indicating if the default number of max iteration should be used in the QR algorithm. If true, the max iterations will be set to the number of rows cubed. If false, the max iterations is specified by the user.

    • computeU

      protected final boolean computeU
      Flag which indicates if the unitary U should be computed in the decomposition.

    • U

      protected CMatrix U
      Storage for the unitary U matrix in the Schur decomposition corresponding to A=UTU<sup>H</sup>.

    • T

      protected CMatrix T
      Storage for the upper triangular T matrix in the Schur decomposition corresponding to A=UTU<sup>H</sup>.

    • hess

      protected HessenburgDecomposition<T extends MatrixMixin<T,​?,​?,​?,​?,​?>> hess
      Decomposer to compute the Hessenburg matrix similar to the source matrix. This Hessenburg matrix will be the actual matrix that the Schur decomposition is computed for.

    • debug

      protected boolean debug

    • in

      protected Scanner in

      protected SchurDecomposition​(int maxIterations)

    • SchurDecomposition

      protected SchurDecomposition​(boolean computeU, int maxIterations)
      Creates a decomposer to compute the Schur decomposition which will run for at most maxIterations iterations.
      Parameters:
      maxIterations - Maximum number of iterations to run when computing the Schur decomposition.
      computeU - A flag which indicates if the unitary matrix Q should be computed.
      - If true, the Q matrix will be computed. - If false, the Q matrix will not be computed. If it is not needed, this may provide a performance improvement.

    • SchurDecomposition

      protected SchurDecomposition​(boolean computeU)
      Creates a decomposer to compute the Schur decomposition.
      Parameters:
      computeU - A flag which indicates if the unitary matrix Q should be computed.
      - If true, the Q matrix will be computed. - If false, the Q matrix will not be computed. If it is not needed, this may provide a performance improvement.

  • Method Details

    • doubleShiftImplicitQR

      protected void doubleShiftImplicitQR​(CMatrix H)
      Computes the Schur decomposition for a complex dense matrix using a double shifted implicit QR algorithm (also known as Francis's Algorithm of degree two).
      Parameters:
      H - The matrix to compute the Schur decomposition of. Assumed to be in upper Hessenburg form.

    • shiftedExplicitQR

      protected void shiftedExplicitQR​(CMatrix H)
      Computes the Schur decomposition for a complex matrix using a shifted QR algorithm where the QR decomposition
      Parameters:
      H - - The matrix to compute the Schur decomposition of. Assumed to be in upper Hessenburg form.

    • getWilkinsonShift

      private CNumber getWilkinsonShift​(CMatrix src)
      Computes the Wilkinson shift for a complex matrix. That is, the eigenvalue of the lower left 2x2 sub matrix which is closest in magnitude to the lower left entry of the matrix.
      Parameters:
      src - Matrix to compute the Wilkinson shift for.
      Returns:
      The Wilkinson shift for the src matrix.

    • getT

      Returns:
      The T from the Schur decomposition corresponding to A=UTU<sup>H</sup>.

    • getU

      public CMatrix getU()
